result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Isaiah J Wallowingbull

records.addlTxt: to amend bond testing conditions, filed by DE. olg     To RG
Status conference on November 15, 2022 at 10:30 am. Includes RMW - 22CM547 and SRN - 22CM515 and 22CM594. sf

AMENDED

Includes 22CM515 & 22CM594

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Daniel S.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. THIS CONDITION SHALL ONLY BE EFFECTIVE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF A 72 HOUR NO CONTACT ORDER.

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to  random ETG testing at least ONE time per week on Tuesdays. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.  I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day. 

Defendant shall contact Kara Rheingans, Case Manager - Behavioral Health at 715-716-0920 within 48 hours. Ms. Rheingans shall conduct an intake screening to determine appropriateness for inclusion in programming offered by Behavioral Health. If you are screened in for services, you shall participate in programming as recommended. Failure to contact Ms. Rheingans or participate may be considered a violation of your bond.

9:16 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Isaiah J Wallowingbull in court, in custody.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman in court for Isaiah J Wallowingbull.  Prosecuting attorney Karl E Anderson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CM515 & 22CM594. Court reviews file notes Atty Erdman has NOR on 22CM515 but not one on 22CM594.  DA Anderson states there was a Global Offer sent last night.  Atty Erdman asking to have 22CM547 Branch IV file trail these files.  Court suggests attorneys to discuss Global Resolution with Branch IV. Atty Erdman asking to modify bond.  Bond arguments.  Court modifies bond.  JA to have these matters trail Branch IV cases.  Adjourned at 9:25 AM. bph
Order for payment on October 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

FOR ATTY FEES. DE to pay $50/mo comm 10/15/22. PPF waived. DE signed Pet for Appt of Atty & will be mailed an Order for Pymt. Includes 22CM515 and 22CM547. kma

PAYMENTS TO BE RECEIPTED TO 22CM515 ONLY.
from JA to DE and Atty. Erdman appointing counsel. kma

Filed by DE, includes 22CM515 and 22CM547. kma

records.addlTxt: Signed by RMW on 9/19/22. Appointing Atty. Erdman; repayment rate of $50/mo commencing 10/15/22. Includes 22CM547 and 22CM515. kma

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Daniel S.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. THIS CONDITION SHALL ONLY BE EFFECTIVE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF A 72 HOUR NO CONTACT ORDER.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

1:18 PM 1:00 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant James Daniel Burton in court, in custody.  Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for James Daniel Burton.  Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin. DE does not qualify for PD, PFAC given to DE. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Court orders bond.  Adjourned at 1:22 PM. bph
